item.title: Reaper Ability Overview | Overwatch

meta.summary:
b"Death walks among you: http://bit.ly/MeetReaper

Some speak of a black-robed terrorist known only as the Reaper. While his true identity and motives are a mystery, what is known is that where he appears, death follows. An extremely volatile mercenary, Reaper has been responsible for attacks across the globe, and some now believe he is hunting former Overwatch agents and systematically eliminating them. 

With his twin Hellfire shotguns and ability to move unscathed through the shadows, Reaper is one of the world's deadliest threats.

Like Us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/playoverwatch 
Follow Us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/playoverwatch"

item.title: Overwatch: High Impact Reaper Flank Tactics - Advanced Guide

meta.summary:
b"Edgelords UNITE! Reaper is seemingly a basic hero, but executing his plays in order to get impactful value takes a bit of finesse, talon trickery if-you-will. We've made more full reaper guides in the past on how to Lurk and Pounce targets which are linked below as well as on a clickable card on-screen, but today we slow down into the minutia of both the mechanics and psychology of executing a play, which requires you to both know how to set it up as well as see it through with confidence to result in high impact reaper flanks. This style of advanced guide is a little different from what we've done in the past and updates our previous guides in a way that unlocks those tactics mentioned earlier if you struggled with them. item.title: SPIRIT - GRANDMASTER REAPER GAMEPLAY TIPS | How To Improve As Reaper Guide - Overwatch Season 8

meta.summary:
b"Today we are back again trying a top 500 tip Reaper video because I think its fun and people just love Reaper it seems. Today we are talking about how the grandmaster Reaper player can carry his competitive games in season 8 overwatch competitive ranked mode guide for overwatch season 8 placement matches and overwatch season 8 changes. Going over some Reaper season 8 tips and guide or whatever you want to call it. I hope that these tips can help to have you guys learn how to improve as Reaper and hope this works as a mini Reaper guide tip trick thing for all that want to improve as her. Anyways, thanks! *Reaper in the new season competitive ranked 8 guide tips.*




More GM Gameplay Tip Videos Here! : https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLefC4eOMnbRF5Xm7uCjfU73bh0ybup9Df



Gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GztX_uD510A
Thumbnail:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-Credits:
Spirit
https://twitter.com/spiritow_
https://twitch.tv/spiritow
https://discord.gg/rwqn3q3

======================================================================

TIPS I WROTE DOWN FROM THE VIDEO:
-his team is runnning dive comp, take high ground to beat the enemy shields
-reaper can play as a sheild breaker or a burst flanker, look at your teamcomps and theirs to decide which
-its hard for reaper to take out a lot of dps by himself, but with a support or tank you can 2v2 them easily
-he focuses junk first as he has little peel and no self heal
-spirit likes to go on high ground but will fall back down often
-when rat tires he instantly tries to shoot it, and wraith forms at the last second
-spirit is using high ground a lot more than he used to, if he knows the enemies arent on it, he takes it
-when you see a mccree, try to shoot him once and then wraith form, wastes his flashbang and you can escape
-on this last teamfight he focuses reinhardt first to get life steal and stay alive

-reaper can work ok on defense with one healer because of self heal, easier to do with aan orisa or rein tho
-the only way you can kill widow is to flank her without her noticing you, if she keeps finding you, play frontline
-your hitbox is huge and many heroes CAN EASILY one shot you, sometimes you need to take thatrisk
-ask in voice chat to be nano boosted, and try to get the boost as you wraith form in
-try to always get a shot off on somebody before you ult to guarentee a kill
-against most heroes at mid range just shoot their mid bodies,
-if a tank is looking away from you, also shoot their midb bodies to hit the most pellets
-if you camp high ground you can stop enemy dva or winston from taking it, thats better than your benefit
-try to not run at the enemies through open ground, if there is a side route to getting somewhere, go there
-try to not waste your ult vs a zen ult, to do this bodyshot somebody and then ult, you will at least get that kill
-reaper is one of the best heroes to nano without ult, try to take out the tanks with headshots first here



======================================================================

item.title: Overwatch: How to Be a Pro Reaper - Lurk & Pounce Advanced Guide

meta.summary:
b'HarryHook is the one pro right now that utilizes Reaper. At MLG Vegas, Harryhook used Reaper in a Lurk and Pounce playstyle to quickly take duels against enemy DPS' , win the duel and snowball teamfights from there. The key to utilizing an "on-meta" hero like this, is to set up the hero by avoiding their counters and finding their value fast. In this way, Reaper doesn't look off-meta at all, just simply a way to dish out burst damage, if you hit the close range shots putting all the spread into the hitbox. -F

item.title: Overwatch Reaper Guide - FASTEST Start Of Match Flanks | Part 1

meta.summary:
b"Overwatch Reaper Guide - FASTEST Start Of Match Flanks 
This is a video showing some of my favorite spots to use reapers shadow step ability on hard capture points at the start of games. These spots are designed to get fast kills at the beginning of rounds to help your team break enemy defenses as fast as possible.

Since Overwatch was released I've always loved Reapers ability to output insane amounts of damage. When you add Reapers damage with his flanking capacity you can really become a problem for the enemy team. If you can learn how to utilize this hero's toolkit you may find it a bit easier to start ranking up in competitive games.

item.title: Overwatch Reaper Guide | How to Play REAPER (In-Depth Stats, Tips, and Match Ups) Reaper Gameplay

meta.summary:
b"Today in Overwatch, I'll be showing you how to play Reaper with some tips and tricks on how to do better with this hero. This guide will go pretty in depth as far as numbers go, but I won't be surprised if the numbers get changed as Overwatch ages so I'll be sure to catalog the changes down here in the description.

Additional tips:

PapiDimmi 1 hour ago
This is a fantastic video. Youve earned yourself a new subscriber, my man. Well, I knew all of this information, but I still found your gameplay enjoyable (especially when you camped the Teleporter), as well as your commentary.

However, you forgot to mention that you move faster than normally in Wraith Form, which can be useful to use to get back into battle after you respawn after your death. You can also get quickly back into bettle using Shadow Step; however, thats quite self-explanatory.

You also did not mention that using your melee attack right after reloading shortens the reload time to one second, which can be useful to reload faster mid-battle.

Also, you didnt mention that you can jump during the use of Death Blossom, and that you can collect health packs (and Souls) during the use of Wraith Form.


Special thanks goes out to MOARNial for the Overwatch Victory Theme REMIX, check it out here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ciA-SxFhIMQ

twitter: @moarnial

*Channel Banner and Logo made by Tomographic (HIT HIM UP IF YOU WANT AWESOME ARTWORK DONE!)
https://twitter.com/ItsTomographic
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOt5hVyS2-nbcJ3_FP41Ajg"

item.title: Overwatch Reaper Guide - FASTEST Start Of Match Flanks | Part 2

meta.summary:
b'Overwatch Reaper Guide - FASTEST Start Of Match Flanks | Part 2.
This is my second video showing some of my favorite spots to use reapers shadow step ability on hard capture points at the start of a match. These small map tricks are designed to get fast kills at the beginning of rounds to help your team break enemy defenses as fast as possible.

I plan to eventually cover all of the different choke point heavy maps but In this video, we went over Hollywood and Temple Of Anubis. I also show during the second half that it is not uncommon to pick up first blood within 13 sec of the round starting. So I do hope this little Overwatch Reaper guide helps someone out there pick up a few extra wins along the way! 

I hope you find some of this information helpful, please leave a like and let me know in the comments what you would like to see next.

item.title: Overwatch Reaper Guide - FASTEST Start Of Match Flanks | Part 3

meta.summary:
b"Overwatch Reaper Guide - FASTEST Start Of Match Flanks | Part 3 of the ongoing series where I show my favorite spots to use reapers shadow step ability at the start of a match. These flanks help me to pick up some really fast kills and secure some of the harder capture points in overwatch. I hope they can work the same for you. 

This video is a bit different from the others in this series. I wouldn't say Horizon Lunar Colony is necessarily a hard capture point on attack, but I show how effective one of these flanks can be here. Junkertown, on the other hand, can be quite tricky if the enemy team stops your first push, so I'm happy to share the way I like to use reaper on both maps. 

I hope you find some of this information helpful, please leave a like and let me know in the comments what you would like to see next.
The plan is to at least have 2-3 more videos in this reaper fast flanks series, but while I'm gathering clips I'll also be working on some new projects within overwatch and out in other games. 

I'm super happy with the feedback that I've received so far in these reaper videos, so if your reading this thank you for stopping by! =D

For future reference: when I'm playing competitively in any game I will always keep pretty positive and rage free. Worst case with leavers or when I feel that I could have done better, I may get frustrated and stop for the day. When I'm not playing competitive games then I'm probably off somewhere being a subtle troll in some other multiplayer game. It's a passion and it brings real joy to my life lol

Like My Content? Subscribe for More!
https://goo.gl/M92cN6 

If you want to give me any suggestion on new video ideas, join the discord and let me know. I'd love to also bring a community of gamers together that like to share or talk about music/art/anime/games/randomness

Discord Community Channel: https://discord.gg/SMfbEyA

Current 2 battletags #Zowlufin #Randomized / Peak - Master 3658"
